issues.summary: Stage - Accounts Payable - Dates filter has its calendar pop up not showing up.
issues.description: URL: https://stage-go.vroozi.com Username:  asma.latif+APM@vroozi.com Password: Blueangel1@ / Blueangel1! PreCondition: AP User should have logged into the Application Steps: Access Inbox>Document Inbox grid. Click in the Search Bar against the grid. Select 'Received Date'>OnAfter/Before. Please see MM/DD/YYYY shows but the Calendar pop up does not show up for date selection. Note:  The issue seems Application wide with all grid Pages where date filter is an option like Track Invoices/Memo, PO grid, RFQ list, Shipping Notices, Invoices, Post Invoice/Memo/PRQ. The Calendar pop up is unavailable currently. Actual Result Calendar pop up does not show up for date selection. expected result  Calendar pop up should show for date selection. Screenshot: AP > Hopper PMAN > PO SP > Invoices Thanks, Asma

issues.summary: PMAN:: The Project and Class fields become empty when the user reopens a newly added line item during POCR.
issues.description: Server:  https://stage-go.vroozi.com/#/login Credentials: Employee:  javaid.sattar+emp1@vroozi.com  / Welcome1@   Pre- Requisite: Purchase Order should be available in Ordered state. Steps to Reproduce: Login with above user. Go to Purchase orders. Open any PO Add New item and provides all accounting information.  save line item.  Actual Result: The Project and Class fields become empty when the user reopens a newly added line item during POCR. Expected Result: The accounting elements should remain populated as they were saved during the line item creation.

issues.summary: PMAN: Demo Feedback - Newly added API endpoints are inconsistent as it should use dash (-) instead of underscore (_) in the url.
issues.description: Please update the following endpoints by changing “_“ to “-” so it becomes consistent with other APIs. /cost-centers/async_requests/{trackingId} /wbs-elements/async_requests/{trackingId} /gl-accounts/async_requests/{trackingId} /approval-groups/async_requests/{trackingId}

issues.summary: PMan: API - Cost Centers Async request not displaying "parentRef" on the cost center master data grid when created through API.
issues.description: Environment:  Devqa21, unitId 2 Pre Conditions: Postman endpoint  https://{{domain}}/v1/cost-centers/bulk-upsert/async  is accessible. Postman endpoint https://{{domain}}/v1/ cost-centers /async_requests/ is accessible. Steps to Reproduce: create a new cost center through API having a parent cost center id in it. Login from PMan application and verify the issue on Cost Center grid. Expected Results: Parent reference should be displayed on the grid of Cost Center against “Parent Cost Center” column . Actual Results: “N/A” is being displayed against “Parent Cost Center” column on the grid.

issues.summary: Reserve or Allowed characters list for mongo neo4j solr elasticsearch
issues.description: We have recently encountered an issue with HEB where they have a dash in the Company category codes that is causing issues with the Solr search. We have another client Maersk Visible with whom there is a possibility that the category mapping would have special characters like a dash or underscore. Please see if you can provide a list of allowed characters for Solr, Neo4j, Mongo and elasticsearch. This would be helpful for us to use a character that does not cause any issues for the customer.

issues.summary: Chatbot: Improve logic around message box
issues.description: Current State The current message box does not display properly when it contains more than one line of text. Goal Ensure that the message box displays up to 3 lines correctly, and enable scrolling functionality for content that exceeds this.

issues.summary: Chatbot: Simplify logic around typing indicator
issues.description: Current State The typing indicator logic is complicated because it relies on the  message.typing  flag, which could be in different parts of the code, possibly leading to multiple sources of truth and complex conditions. It may involve updates across multiple functions Goal (Simplification) Single boolean flag : Instead of having a  message.typing  flag in each message object, use a single  typing  flag in the chat component to track whether the current user or any user is typing. Centralized state : This simplifies the management of the typing state and decouples it from the message objects, making the state easier to manage and update.

issues.summary: Payables: Hopper Issue - Resolve SocketException: Too many open files
Payables: Hopper Issue - Resolve DuplicateKeyException
issues.description:
In investigation found wile creating processing the Email some time two thread processing the same email in a same causing Duplicate key exception in production. Issue related to duplicate Key   Exception for Mearsk: 2024-11-05 17:31:22,890 c.v.m.e.s.InvoiceEmailServiceImpl [InvoiceEmailServiceImpl.java:169] - Error while processing {"emailId":"maersk@invoice.vroozi.com","status":"AUTHORIZED","alias":false,"errorMessage":null,"requiresReAuthorization":false,"freeMemoryNeeded":0,"id":"63734d42e9ba1a4e95ca136a","unitId":"248","userId":null,"createdDate":"Tue Nov 15 08:26:42 UTC 2022","updatedDate":"Tue Nov 15 08:26:56 UTC 2022","deletedDate":null,"deleted":false}
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
org.springframework.dao.DuplicateKeyException: Write operation error on server prod-shard-00-01.r7pau.mongodb.net:27017. Write error: WriteError{code=11000, message='E11000 duplicate key error collection: vroozi.hopper_emails index: messageId dup key: { messageId: "192fce2304da792e" }', details={}}.; nested exception is com.mongodb.MongoWriteException: Write operation error on server prod-shard-00-01.r7pau.mongodb.net:27017. Write error: WriteError{code=11000, message='E11000 duplicate key error collection: vroozi.hopper_emails index: messageId dup key: { messageId: "192fce2304da792e" }', details={}}.
	at org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.MongoExceptionTranslator.translateExceptionIfPossible(MongoExceptionTranslator.java:106) ~[spring-data-mongodb-3.3.10.jar:3.3.10]
  Reading email for Maerks: [33m2024-11-05 17:30:36,973[0;39m [34mINFO[0;39m [32mc.v.m.e.s.InvoiceEmailServiceImpl[0;39m - Found 101 new emails in total to be processed for address: maersk@invoice.vroozi.com
[33m2024-11-05 17:31:22,818[0;39m [34mINFO[0;39m [32mc.v.m.e.s.InvoiceEmailServiceImpl[0;39m - Found 102 new emails in total to be processed for address: maersk@invoice.vroozi.com
[33m2024-11-05 17:32:57,336[0;39m [34mINFO[0;39m [32mc.v.m.e.s.InvoiceEmailServiceImpl[0;39m - Found 103 new emails in total to be processed for address: maersk@invoice.vroozi.com The reason for duplicate records exception in production is that every minute, we are retrieving all emails for all clients, one by one, that have not been downloaded yet and saving them to the database. The problem occurs when a client suddenly receives a large number of emails, as shown in the logs. For example, we might download 101 emails and start processing them, but after one minute, the process starts again and picks up some of the records that the previous job is already processing. This results in a situation where the first job saves the email, and the second job, trying to save it to the database, encounters a duplicate exception.

issues.summary: Gateway Timeout 504 on Supplier API (Create , Upsert) when system is under load.
issues.description: Steps to Reproduce: Upsert Supplier 504 Timeout Issue: Execution on JMeter:  The issue is not reproducible with a single Postman call but occurs during stress testing in JMeter. Test Setup:  We performed an upsert operation for a single supplier record, sending the request repeatedly with variations in the request payload. This was executed with 500 threads and 500 loop counts. Outcome:  The gateway timeout issue (504) was reproduced when multiple records were processed concurrently. Create Suppliers: Execution on JMeter:  Stress testing was conducted to create new supplier records. Test Setup:  The operation was tested with 500 threads and 500 loop counts to simulate high load conditions. Outcome:  The gateway timeout issue (504) was consistently reproduced. Additionally, we observed 503 Service Unavailable errors and 500 Internal Server errors, indicating server instability under load.

epic.summary: Payables: Enhanced PO Line Item Matching for AP Automation
epic.description: This epic focuses on improving the efficiency and accuracy of the PO line item matching process within the AP workflow. By leveraging a Large Language Model (LLM) for intelligent matching between parsed OCR data from PDF invoices and PO line items, the system will provide advanced tools for side-by-side comparison, user-driven corrections, and enhanced visibility into matching accuracy. Key features include enabling or disabling the PO matching feature at the supplier level, seamless integration of LLM matching logic, user-driven corrections, and dynamic visual indicators for matched, partially matched, and unmatched items. This epic also paves the way for future enhancements, such as leveraging flagged feedback to improve LLM accuracy over time, integrating AI learning loops, and introducing global configuration settings for matching logic. Planned User Stories for this Epic: Add a toggle in the supplier records to enable or disable the PO line item matching feature. Define the data integration process for sending parsed OCR and PO data to the LLM and receiving matching results. Implement a side-by-side comparison view for parsed OCR data and matched PO line items with editing and relinking capabilities. Provide an option to revert to the old system behavior for PO line-item handling. Allow users to flag matched line items as correct or incorrect for future reference and system improvement. Introduce visual indicators to identify perfect matches, partial matches, and unmatched items in invoices and side-by-side comparison views. Future Enhancements Under This Epic: AI-driven suggestions for unmatched or partially matched items based on historical data. Enhanced reporting and analytics for flagged items to track LLM performance. Allow bulk corrections for flagged incorrect matches. Introduce confidence scoring for LLM matching and user review prioritization. Develop customizable matching rules for specific suppliers or document types. This epic will streamline the PO matching process, reduce manual effort, and improve overall accuracy, significantly enhancing AP automation capabilities.

issues.summary: PMAN: Toggle to Enable/Disable PO Line Item Matching Feature for Suppliers.
issues.description: Business Case: Add a toggle in supplier records to enable or disable PO line item matching feature. Acceptance Criteria: What is the change?  As an  Admin , I need a toggle in the supplier records to control whether the PO line item matching feature is applied to the Invoice documents related to a specific supplier. This toggle will ensure that only relevant Invoice documents use the matching logic, while others follow the standard behavior. Which customers should this change impact?  Customers who have ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW = true and Feature toggle ( ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW__PO_LINE_ITEM_MATCHING ) = ON. What pages should this change impact?  Master Data > Suppliers page. Which users should be impacted by the change? Admins. How should this feature work? Pre-Requisites: Conditions in AC #2 are fulfilled. Add a toggle field labeled " Allow PO Line Item Matching " in the supplier records. ( Open to a shorter or different label name ) Default  value for the toggle should be "Disabled." An  Admin  should be able to turn this toggle ON or OFF for a supplier. When the toggle is  enabled  for a supplier, Invoice documents associated with this supplier will use the PO line item matching feature. When the toggle is  disabled , Invoice documents from the supplier will follow the system’s existing behavior. Updates made to the Allow PO Line Item Matching toggle should be saved in the  Supplier Change History . Tooltip - “ When this toggle is turned ON, the system will activate AI-based PO line-item matching for invoices from this supplier. ” Out of Scope:   Adding this toggle to the Supplier Bulk Upload. This will be discussed later with the Purchasing Team once the feature has been developed to an acceptable level. Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  No. Would this change impact existing documents?  Maybe. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All teams. Questions: Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date             # Question Recommendation Response Remarks

issues.summary: PMAN: Introduce Backend Feature Toggle for Enabling/Disabling New PO Line Item Matching Features.
issues.description: Business Case: Add a backend feature toggle to enable or disable the new PO line item matching features for a client. Acceptance Criteria: What is the change?  As a system  Admin , I need a backend feature toggle to control whether the new PO line item matching features (including supplier-level toggles, LLM-based matching, side-by-side mapping, flagging, and visual indicators) are enabled or disabled for a specific client. Additionally, after the backend toggle has been activated, a new preference setting toggle should be visible, allowing Admin users to enable or disable the PO line item matching feature directly from the system. Which customers should this change impact?  Customers who have ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW = true What pages should this change impact?  The invoice page. Which users should be impacted by the change? Users who are allowed to create AP documents, namely, AP Processors, Managers, and Admins, and Users who are allowed to view / edit AP documents. How should this feature work? Feature Toggle Implementation: Introduce a  new  backend feature toggle labeled  ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW__PO_LINE_ITEM_MATCHING . ( Open to shorter or different toggle name ) Default value for the toggle should be  OFF . Preference Setting Toggle: Once the backend feature toggle is turned ON, a new preference setting toggle labeled  "Enable PO Line Item Matching"  should appear under Vroozi Intelligence section. Tooltip text -  “Enable advanced PO line-item matching using AI-powered data processing. This feature compares parsed invoice data with PO line items to improve matching accuracy and provides tools for side-by-side comparison, mapping, and match status visualization. ”. The preference toggle should allow Admin users to control whether the PO line-item matching features are applied to documents within the client’s environment. Default value for the preference toggle should be OFF, even if the backend feature toggle is ON. Behavior When Toggle is OFF: The system retains its existing behavior without introducing any changes related to PO line item matching. Documents follow the standard flow, using PO line items directly if the PO number is captured. No changes to the supplier records or UI for side-by-side comparison or flagging features. Behavior When Toggle is ON: All features developed under the new PO line item matching process should be activated, including: Supplier-level toggle for enabling/disabling PO line item matching. Integration with LLM for data matching between PDF parsed items and PO line items. Side-by-side comparison and editable mapping for OCR data and PO line items. Revert-to-old-behavior option for specific documents. Line item flagging as correct/incorrect. Visual indicators for match statuses (perfect, partial, no match). Many more to come. Testing Requirements: Test all scenarios with the toggle  ON  to ensure new features are functioning correctly. Test with the toggle  OFF  to confirm the system reverts to the original behavior without any impact on existing functionality. Test scenarios where the feature toggle  does not exist  for a client: The system should behave as if the toggle is  OFF , retaining the existing behavior without any changes. Verify that no elements of the new PO line item matching features are visible or accessible to the client in this case. Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  No. Would this change impact existing documents?  Yes – both documents in process and historically processed documents. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All teams. Questions: Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date             # Question Recommendation Response Remarks                     Key Decisions: # Decision Point Decision Reasoning Validation Plan 1 How should we handle documents created before this feature goes in to Production?       2 Identical to the question above, how should we handle the situation when the feature toggle is enabled initially and then disabled at a later point?

epic.summary: Smart Coding Model V2 - Enhancement

issues.summary: Smart Coding Model - Make auto apply model prediction threshold configurable for admin user
issues.description: Requirements: This feature introduces a configurable threshold setting within company settings that determines the minimum confidence level needed for the system to auto-fill predicted values for various accounting fields on an invoice. Admins can specify different confidence thresholds for each accounting object, such as company code or GL account, allowing for tailored auto-fill behavior based on prediction confidence. The system will use these thresholds to determine whether to populate fields automatically during invoice creation, enhancing the accuracy and control over automated data entry. Acceptance Criteria: Introduce Configurable Prediction Thresholds in Company Settings : A new configuration option should be available in smart coding related objects in the company settings, allowing admins to set custom confidence thresholds for each accounting object that the smart coding model can predict. Example: predictionAutoFillThreshold {     companyCode: 0.7,     glAccount: 0.9,     … } Auto-fill Accounting Predictions Based on Confidence Thresholds : When creating an invoice, the system should apply the configured thresholds to auto-fill predictions into the corresponding accounting fields.  If the model's confidence for a given accounting object prediction meets or exceeds the set threshold, the system will auto-populate that accounting field in the invoice line. If the model's prediction confidence is below the configured threshold, the system will not auto-populate the accounting field in the invoice line.

issues.summary: Kafka and kafka connector plugin configuration optimisation
issues.description: The scope of the ticket includes configuration optimisation of kafka and kafka connector plugin. We will be focusing on some RnD work to find out the best possible configurations to address the following tasks. If the kafka connector plugin is crashed we need to auto restart it (OPS) What is the size of the data written on kafka topics, identify if there is a limit and if yes is it enough to audit company settings. Identify how to change the limit if any. (DEV) Identify if the pre and post images are stored in the database as well apart from being written to kafka topics. If YES identify a way to delete these images from the database once they are used for auditing. Identify If connector is down, Does DB retains data, if yes for how much time Performance testing of pre and post audit of company setting update (QA) Identify what will happen in the case of error, does the connector break? Results: A new Rundeck job will be created which will be checking the status of the service and restart in case of failed status. The size is of 1mb which is enough for company settings since there is no document present in production db greater than 100kb. Fine tuning might be required in case we proceed with other collections.  These images are stored in a separate collection  config.system.preimages  and are automatically deleted along with entries from the op_log When the connector is restarted it picks up its lag and audit are the previous entries as well as long as they are available in op_log, if the connector is down for so long that op_log is cleared the entries are gone for good. Done Configurational changes are made to make sure it does not break.

issues.summary: Vroozi API - Bulk upsert Cost Centers
issues.description: Business Case: As an External system user, I want to create/update the Cost Centers in bulk via the API. Acceptance Criteria: Cost Center Bulk Upsert POST API: Another API should be built that allows the user to get the status of the  Cost Center Bulk Upsert POST API  by providing the tracking number. The type of the API should be  GET . If the API does not return the status of the  Cost Center Bulk Upsert POST API  does not return the status, the system should return the error with details. This  Cost Center Bulk Upsert Status GET API  should return the following statuses of the  Cost Center Bulk Upsert POST API: If all the Cost Centers are created/updated successfully, the header level response status should be  COMPLETED. Each Object status should be  SUCCESS. If some or all Cost Centers are still being created or updated, the header level status should be  IN PROGRESS. Each Object status should be  SUCCESS/IN PROGRESS/ERROR  accordingly. If all of the Cost Centers are processed and some or all of them have validation errors, the status should be  COMPLETED WITH ERRORS. Each Object status should be  SUCCESS/ERROR  accordingly. If all the Cost Centers are processing failed due to some technical error (e.g. time out) that can be fixed by retrying, the status should be  FAILURE. Each Object status should be  FAILED If some of the Cost Centers are processing failed due to some technical error (e.g. time out) that can be fixed by retrying and some are processed successfully without any error, the status should be  COMPLETED WITH FAILURE. Each Object status should be  SUCCESS/FAILED  accordingly. This  Cost Center Bulk Upsert Status GET API  should return the count of: Total items Items successfully uploaded Items failed(due to failure or validation error) The  Cost Center Bulk Upsert Status GET API  should return the state of each Cost Center in the API payload: The status should be  In Progress  if the Cost Center is still in Progress. The status should be  Success  if the Cost Center is created successfully. The status should be  Error  if the Cost Center is not created due to: Validation Error Duplication Failure (time out etc) The response should also contain the details of each error type according to the set pattern of showcasing the error details. Documentation: There should be two new entries in the API Documentation in the  Cost Center  sub-menu of the  Master Data  menu Those two entries should be for the following APIs: Cost Center Bulk Upsert POST API ( please use the naming convention as per standards ) The API summary( appears next to the API endpoint ) should be ‘ Create or Update the Cost Center s  in bulk asynchronously’ . The details should be ' Create or Update the Cost Centers in bulk asynchronously '. Cost Center Bulk Upsert Status GET API ( please use the naming convention as per standards ) The API summary( appears next to the API endpoint ) should be ‘ Get progress status of the bulk upsert Cost Center by Tracking ID ’. The details should be ' Get progress status of the bulk upsert Cost Center by Tracking ID '. Technical Details:    Q&A:  Integration Team  (                           ) Question Response Action

issues.summary: Parent unitID - Admin Users: Enable Admins to edit the name and description for the linked child unitIDs.
issues.description: This ticket was split from   , on 10/21/2024 at the dev team’s request, to simplify testing efforts. It is only meant to deal with the original tickets' requirements for making the cells in the first 2 columns of the table editable. See the section highlighted in  Red .  Business Case: As a standard feature, all users that log into a Parent unitID must be able to access a list of child unitIDs that they can navigate to, in order to conduct business. This should be available to Non-admin users in the Parent unitID by default, and to Admin users as an option (once we introduce the reporting dashboard for them).  Acceptance Criteria: Prerequisites: The unitID must be configured to work as a Parent unitID There must be at least 2 Child unitIDs connected to it.  The user logging in has access to child unitIDs and must be a Parent unitID user How should the user be able to get to this list of Child unitIDs? When the user logs into the Parent unitID, this is the screen they should land on.  If the user is on another screen in the Parent unitID, they should be able to navigate to this screen by clicking on the “Business Units” link in the left nav bar.  What should the user see on this screen when they land on it? The user should see a message at the top of the screen.  This message should read “ TBD “. The user should be able to dismiss this message by clicking on a “Close” button in the section containing the message.  However, this message should reappear when the user logs into the application again. While still logged in, if the user dismisses the message, there is no need to display it again, for the duration of that logged in session.  When the user navigatess back to the Parent unitID, from a child unitID, the system can once again display the message, unless the user had previously clocked on the “Don’t show again“ checkbox.  The user should be able to dismiss the message for good, by checking the “Don’t show again“ checkbox next to the “Close” button.  The user should see the page title as “Business Units“ The user should see a table below that, with the following columns:  Business Unit Description Last Accessed on Action The Business Unit column should list all the Child unitIDs linked to the current Parent unitID, that the logged in user has access to. By default, this list should display the values found in these Child unitID’s Company  → Profile → Company Name field.  The Description column should only display a value if the Parent unitID Admin provides a description for this Child unitID. Otherwise, the column can show an “n/a” for rows that do not have a description.  The Last Accessed on column should display the most recent date that the user navigated to that specific child unitID. This value should be updated by the system, every time the user navigates to that specific Child unitID.  The Action column should include icons for the following controls:  Edit The Edit icon should ONLY be available to the user if they have the Parent unitID Admin role assigned.  The Edit icon should be a pencil glyph Clicking on this should make the first 2 cells for that specific row editable. and change the pencil icon to a “save” icon (perhaps a “tick mark”).  The cell in the Business Unit column is mandatory. The user should not be able to save the row without providing some value in this cell. This cell CANNOT use the same value as another Child unitID that’s connected to the current Parent unitID. If the user enters such a value, the system should highlight the text input field with a red border, and display a red “!” icon in the input field; aligned to the right edge of the field. Hovering over this icon should display a tool-tip with the message “TBD“.  The cell in the Description column is optional. The user can save the row without providing a value in this field if they don’t want to.  Navigate to The Navigate to icon should be visible to all users that log into the Parent unitID and have access to that specific Child unitID.  The Navigate to icon should be a square with an arrow pointing up and to the right, out of it.  Clicking on this should navigate the user to that specific child unitID, in the same browser tab.  How many unitIDs will be listed in this table? There is no restriction at the moment, on how many child unitIDs can be linked to a parent unitID, or how many of those a single user can be given access to.  The table should list a maximum of 10 rows, after which it should paginate the data.

issues.summary: Allow the system to always direct users of a Parent unitID, to that unitID when logging in
issues.description: Business Case: When a user belonging to a “Parent” unitID; as defined in   , logs into the system with their username & password, Vroozi needs a way to identify this user and upon authenticating them, must route them into the parent unitID, instead of a child unitID. Alternatively, if the user logging into the system is identified as NOT belonging to a parent unitID, they should be directed to the single child unitID that they belong to, as usual.  Why do this? Why don’t we just log the parent unitID’s user directly into the parent unitID, like we do for child unitID users? The reason we are adding this logic to the authentication process is because, in the future, we will want to allow Admins in the parent unitID to selectively “upgrade” a child unitID’s user to a parent unitID user. Whereby, when that upgraded user logs into Vroozi in the future, we will want to route them to the parent unitID, instead of the child unitID their user account was originally created in.  Acceptance Criteria: Prerequisites: The feature flag added in    should be enabled for this parent unitID.  There should be at least 1 child unitID linked to this parent unitID.  One or more users should exist in this parent unitID and be active.  One or more users should exist in the linked child unitID(s) and be active.  There should be a way to identify users with access to a parent unitID. This identifier could, in the futre, be used for reporting as well.  When the user enters their username/passwrod combination on the Vroozi login screen, and submits it to the BE service for processing, the system should fetch the user’s record from the DB based on the provided credentials.  From this user record, the system needs to determine if this user has access to the parent unitID, or to a child unitID. If the system determines that the user belongs to a parent unitID, then the user should be routed to the relevant parent unitID.  If the system determines that the user does not belong to a parent unitID, then the user should be routed to the appropriate child unitID that they belong to.   to create a separate ticket for this requirement below:   A user CANNOT exist in multiple child unitIDs without also belonging to a parent unitID.

issues.summary: Enable Vroozi Ops to define a Parent unitID's Child unitIDs
issues.description: Business Case: We need to enable specific users in Maersk to oversee, and to some degree, manage the multiple Vroozi unitIDs that they will be using in PROD. We do NOT want to change how indivudal unitIDs are provisioned, or run on a given server. However, we want to enable the creation of a “Parent” entity over an arbitrary number of individual unitIDs. This “Parent” will be used to view aggregrate reporting data against all the child unitIDs, and also wo provision user accounts for users that need to access multiple child unitIDs.  Acceptance Criteria: Prerequisites: The feature toggle introduced in    should be enabled for the unitID.  Vroozi should be able to specify an arbitrary number of active unitIDs on a given server, as “Child” unitIDs of the current “Parent” unitID.  A single unitID cannot be the “Child” of multiple “Parent” unitIDs.  A unitID that is already flagged as a “Parent” unitID cannot be the “Child” unitID of another parent.  A unitID that is already a “Child” unitID and is linked to an eisting “Parent”, cannot be designated as a Parent unitID.  It should be possible for Vroozi to establish this link between parent/child unitIDs at both unitID creation time, as well as after the fact.  We will need to create data-fix scripts for use by Ops, which will:  Convert an existing unitID into a Child unitID of an existing Parent unitID Convert multiple existing unitIDs into Child unitIDs of an existing Parent unitID
